moves.1. e4 e5: A very common opening I use it in many of my games
moves.2. d3: protecting the pawn and giving the black square bishop a path out
moves.4. h3: takes away option Ng3 and Nxf2 completing the Fried Liver Attack ( there is other type of the Fried Liver Attack)
moves.6. Nf3: nice attack on the bishop + retreat
moves.8. e5: gets the night out of there
moves.8... Nd5 9. Qe2: more protection on the e pawn
moves.12. exf6 Nxf6: the knight is stuck there for a while
moves.13. O-O-O Nb4 14. a3: good attack on the developing knight
moves.14... Nc6 15. Nd2 Nd4 16. Nf3: VERY bad mistake knight takes the queen
moves.19... Qc6 20. Bf1: what was the meaning of that move???
moves.20... d6 21. Nd4 Qa6 22. Be2 c5: getting rid of the night that was blocking lots of moves
moves.23. Nf3 Be6 24. Ng5: attack on the bishop (in this position the bishop is very powerful)
moves.24... Bf7: retreats bishop hoping he doesn't trade
moves.26. Rh2: g pawn saved (i would have preferred Rg1)
moves.28. Bd2: that move was almost like he was asking for checkmate!
